I want to encourage everyone who’s thinking “oh I couldn’t pull this off because I don’t have clear skin” to just _try it_. I don’t have the best skin either; it’s actually the reason why I started watching all these makeup videos. I had hideous skin and tried to combat that by putting on foundation. The thing is... I don’t think foundation helped (it may have made my skin worse actually idk, I can’t be 100% sure about this). So one day because I was in a rush I skipped foundation and used concealer only (I use Clio’s Kill Cover Liquid Concealer - it dries quickly so you can layer more on if you haven’t achieved the coverage you need) to do “pin point correcting” — and by that I mean I would dot my scars with the concealer then use a concealer brush or beauty blender to flatten the lump of concealer and blend it into my skin. Haven’t looked back since. The results are just as good as when I used foundation and on top of that, because I don’t have a sheet of product slathered on my skin and instead only where I need it, I don’t get any tell-tale creasing either; my skin looks super “naturally” blemish free (it’s not lol). All the best everyone may you be blessed with great skin.
